thread.title: Manchester United v Watford LIVE: Plus EPL scores, results | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Manchester United v Watford LIVE: Plus EPL scores, results | Daily Mail Online

author: Dan Ripley For Mailonline
title: Manchester United v Watford LIVE: Plus EPL scores, results | Daily Mail Online
text:
14:08 Full line-ups from the Stadium of Light 
Sunderland: Mannone, Denayer, O'Shea, Kone, Jones, Ndong, Gibson, Larsson, Oviedo, Januzaj, Defoe. Subs: Borini, Khazri, Mika, Lescott, Pienaar, Manquillo, Honeyman. 
Southampton: Forster, Cedric, Stephens, Yoshida, Bertrand, Ward-Prowse, Romeu, Davis, Redmond, Gabbiadini, Tadic.Subs: Gardos, Long, Rodriguez, Hojbjerg, McQueen, Sims, Hassen. 
Referee: Paul Tierney (Lancashire) Full line-ups from the London Stadium 
West Ham: Randolph, Kouyate, Fonte, Reid, Cresswell, Feghouli, Noble, Obiang, Snodgrass, Antonio, Lanzini.Subs: Nordtveit, Adrian, Collins, Byram, Fletcher, Calleri, Fernandes. 
West Brom: Foster, Nyom, Dawson, McAuley, Brunt, Fletcher, Livermore, Phillips, Morrison, Chadli, Rondon.Subs: Olsson, Robson-Kanu, Yacob, Evans, Marc Wilson, Myhill, McClean. 
Referee: Michael Oliver (Northumberland) Full line-ups from Old Trafford 
Man Utd: de Gea, Valencia, Bailly, Smalling, Blind, Ander Herrera, Pogba, Mata, Mkhitaryan, Martial, Ibrahimovic.Subs: Rooney, Lingard, Carrick, Rashford, Romero, Fellaini, Darmian. 
Watford: Gomes, Britos, Kaboul, Prodl, Cathcart, Holebas, Zarate, Capoue, Cleverley, Niang, Deeney.Subs: Mariappa, Success, Behrami, Doucoure, Janmaat, Okaka, Arlauskis. 
Referee: Robert Madley (West Yorkshire) 14:04 Full line-ups from the bet 365 Stadium 
Stoke: Grant, Bardsley, Shawcross, Martins Indi, Pieters, Whelan, Adam, Sobhi, Allen, Arnautovic, Crouch.Subs: Muniesa, Johnson, Berahino, Afellay, Diouf, Imbula, Given. 
Crystal Palace: Hennessey, Ward, Tomkins, Delaney, Van Aanholt, Milivojevic, McArthur, Zaha, Puncheon, Townsend, Christian Benteke.Subs: Speroni, Flamini, Remy, Campbell, Schlupp, Sakho, Cabaye. 
Referee: Martin Atkinson (W Yorkshire) 14:02 Full line-ups from the Riverside Stadium 
Middlesbrough: Valdes, Chambers, Bernardo, Gibson, Da Silva, De Roon, Clayton, Forshaw, Traore, Negredo, Stuani.Subs: Ayala, Leadbitter, Guzan, Downing, Ramirez, Guedioura, Gestede. 
Everton: Robles, Coleman, Ashley Williams, Funes Mori, Baines, Davies, Gana, Schneiderlin, Lookman, Lukaku, Barkley.Subs: Jagielka, Kone, Lennon, Barry, Valencia, Stekelenburg, Holgate. 
Referee: Mike Dean (Wirral) 14:00 From Sportsmail's Sam Cuningham at the London Stadium Andy Carroll not in West Ham's squad. Told he has a 'slight groin' injury and failed a late fitness test. Trained yesterday. â€” Sam Cunningham (@samcunningham) February 11, 2017 13:59 A slip into a dab... 
Jokes about Steven Gerrard slipping to cost Liverpool the league title have become tiresome in recent times, but fair play to these Manchester United fans for adding a rather fresh take on it... 
Team news coming next. Manchester United fans show off a banner showing Steven Gerrard's slip against Chelsea from 2014 as a dab 13:52 Everton fired six against Bournemouthlast weekend... 
But they come up against a relegation threatened Middlesbrough team who, apart from Everton, have conceded fewer goals than any team outside the top six. 
Can Ronald Koeman's side be just as clinical in front of goal this afternoon? Romelu Lukaku of Everton arrives at Middlesbrough fresh from scoring four past Bournemouth Tom Davies (right) and Mason Holgate of Everton arrive at the Riverside Stadium Manager Ronald Koeman of Everton hopes to lead Everton to their fourth win in five games 13:42 LIVE: Arsenal v Hull City - follow all the action as it happens 
Arsenal are looking to bounce back from successive defeats by Watford and Chelsea as they take on a relegation threatened Hull City side who have improved slightly under Marco Silva. 
We will be focusing on all the 3pm action on this page but to follow all the north London action join Sportsmail's Adam Shergold on this link for all the drama. 13:35
